alert.note: Alert for Hays; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 4:25AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Hays, Travis and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM CST, Doppler radar reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing with multiple low water crossings closed across the Austin Metro area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Pflugerville, Kyle, Taylor, Buda, Elgin, Wimberley, Windemere, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Tanglewood Forest, Hutto, Manor, West Lake Hills, Woodcreek, Rollingwood, Thrall, Bear Creek, Barton Creek and Coupland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
